ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more basic French for every-day conversations. I also learned how to pronounce better.
My knowledge of French increased, such as my ability to formulate more complex sentences and speak with better fluidity.
I strengthen my speaking, reading, and writing abilities and got more comfortable participating in class as the semester went on.
How to speak French in everyday life
I gained skills such as communication in another language, constructing sentences from the grammar provided, and using this language in daily conversations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: You can retain a lot of what is learned, which is a good strength of this course. A possible weakness is the online platform used for homework.

I felt like this course was not organized well at all. Having two teachers was really difficult as I felt that the expectations were different sometimes. The lack of a clear syllabus meant planning my work each week was next to impossible.

Very realistic settings and applications of content taught in class. The homework helped to cement concepts taught in class a lot and was engaging, but some of the activities were very similar so it felt repetitive and unnecessary at times, especially because we were assigned quite a lot of homework everyday.
The classes were extremely engaging and the professor was always willing to help I found that the work was somewhat redundant and excessive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend if you want to go to Paris and be able to talk with the people there!

Yes. I think French is a nuanced language to approach, but our instructor was incredible! I think it all depends on if you see yourself wanting to continue with French or not, as well. Ultimately, this is up to the discretion of other students' opinions and plans, but I really enjoyed immersing myself more in French.
I would recommend this course if there was a homework syllabus provided. Also, Mme De Vos is genuinely the nicest human being on this planet and an amazing instructor.

Yes! Although classes are everyday, the class size is pretty small, about 10-15 students, so it feels more homey and it is easy to make good friends there, especially because the lessons are engaging and team-work is very often practised.
Yes, I think this class helps a lot with french foundations and sets you up well to start formulating sentences on your own as well as speaking the language fluently.
